headline: Has The Pullback in Arthur J. Gallagher Created a More Attractive Entry Point in 2025?
summary: Wondering if Arthur J. Gallagher is still worth the premium at around $245 a share, or if the market is finally offering a smarter entry point? The stock has slipped about 1.3% over the last week and is down 11.1% year to date, after a 19.5% drop over the past 12 months, even though the 3 and 5 year returns are still a solid 29.7% and 119.7% respectively. Recent headlines have focused on Gallagher’s steady dealmaking in the brokerage space and its push to deepen its specialty insurance...
